We are currently on a 2 hour delay today! Please stay tuned for any updates.

TMES/TMMS/Casita Severe Weather Policy

Even though we are not an APS school, we follow APS for severe weather delays and cancellations. To find out if TMES/TMMS/Casita classes are delayed or cancelled, simply watch a local television station or listen to the radio. If APS has a delay, our classes will begin 2 hours past the normal time. This means middle school classes will start at 10:30 am (drop-off starting at 10:20 am) and our elementary/preschool students will start at 11:00 am (drop-off starting at 10:30 am). If APS cancels school for the day, we will also cancel school for the day. Please note that APS differentiates schools as "Mountain Schools" and "APS schools." We do not follow the mountain school delays or cancellations. If school is delayed or cancelled, before school care is also cancelled. If school is cancelled during the school day, After Care will also be cancelled. In addition, please be sure to dress your child warmly; it gets cold on our playground.

With a "Winter Storm Warning" for Albuquerque tomorrow, we wanted to remind you of our inclement weather policy. Please stay up-to-date on local television and radio stations.

Our Severe Weather Policy - We follow APS for severe weather delays and cancellations.

Casita, TMES & TMMS adheres to APS decisions in regards to ‚ÄúClosed‚Äù or ‚ÄúDelays‚Äù. ‚ÄúSchool Closed‚Äù means no school, no childcare. ‚ÄúTwo hour Delay‚Äù means classes start 2 hours later than normal (ie: 11:00 am instead of 9:00 am). School Delay = No Before Care available. Early Dismissal = No After Care available. Please tune in to major local media outlets to get the most up to date information.
Please note that APS differentiates schools as "Mountain Schools" and "APS schools." We are not a mountain school.

In addition, please be sure to dress your child warmly; it gets cold on our playground.

You can see APS weather delay/closure updates here: https://www.aps.edu/about-us/school-delays

TMES/TMMS participated in the worldwide Rolling Wave of Peace.
